title-group.article-title: Deregulation in Investment Banking: Shelf Registrations, Structure, and Performance

abstract.p: Rule 415, or shelf registration, essentially changes the regulation of investment banking to permit continuous primary offerings that may lower issue costs due to greater underwriter competition and financing flexibility. This paper explores the impact of shelf registration on the structure and performance of the investment banking industry. Shelf registration has adversely affected the profitability of some investment banks, and at the same time industry concentration has increased. However, the results to date do not support the negative public policy effects that were alleged prior to this regulatory change.
